Class SparseMatrix<E>

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.mathematics.linearalgebra.matrices.SparseMatrix<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of scalar elements
All Implemented Interfaces:
Matrix<E>, AbelianGroup<Matrix<E>>, AbelianMonoid<Matrix<E>>, Group<Matrix<E>>, Magma<Matrix<E>>, Monoid<Matrix<E>>, Ring<Matrix<E>>, Semiring<Matrix<E>>, Set<Matrix<E>>, Module<Matrix<E>, E>
public class SparseMatrix<E> extends Object implements Matrix<E>
A sparse matrix implementation using CSR (Compressed Sparse Row) format.

CSR format uses three arrays:

  • values: non-zero values in row-major order
  • colIndices: column index for each value
  • rowPointers: start index in values[] for each row (length = rows + 1)

Benefits:

  • Efficient row slicing and matrix-vector multiplication
  • Compact memory for sparse matrices
  • GPU-friendly format (cuSPARSE compatible)

Since:
2.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

  • Constructor Details

    • SparseMatrix

      public SparseMatrix(E[] values, int[] colIndices, int[] rowPointers, int rows, int cols, Field<E> field)
      Creates a SparseMatrix from CSR format arrays.
      Parameters:
      values - array of non-zero values
      colIndices - column indices (same length as values)
      rowPointers - row start indices (length = rows + 1)
      rows - number of rows
      cols - number of columns
      field - the field structure
